instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v .02amp all ports, no liquid damage
threads.message: not sure where to start, getting 5v .02amp on all ports, after a min or so drops to 5v 0amp, on all ports, ppbus is 12.34v, 3v LDO present all 4 cd32, 1.5v LDO present all 4

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v .02amp all ports, no liquid damage
threads.message: Did you test with correct charger (96/140W)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v .02amp all ports, no liquid damage
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 96842, member: 682"]
Did you test with correct charger (96/140W)?
[/QUOTE]
yes using oem 96w charger, noticed after a min or so goes to 5v 0 amp on all ports, when i first switch ports says 20v 0amp for a sec then resets back to 5v .2 amp, then drops to 5v 0amp,  tried to enter dfu but not responding

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v .02amp all ports, no liquid damage
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> fluctuates too?
Check voltage on small coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.

BTW, write directly into reply box (under the last post), instead of clicking Reply button.
I don't see any reason to quote an entire post visible few centimeters above.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v .02amp all ports, no liquid damage
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> stays 12.34v coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> have 0v, looks like dead short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SOCPMU</SIGNAL>, all caps reading .03ohm, should i replace <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v .02amp all ports, no liquid damage
threads.message:
It comes from <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_T</SIGNAL> (L7660).
There are many components connected.
Voltage injection method should help you to find the culprit.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v .02amp all ports, no liquid damage
